headline.main: Not All of Mr. Laski's Points Suited to Us

lead_paragraph: Harold J. Laski's letter in THE TIMES of Jan. 18, written for the purpose of impressing upon the American people "the urgency, at this time, not merely of realizing the paramount importance of victory, but of the ends for which that victory is attained," and the principles which he states we must accept as the "inarticulate major premises' of our thinking," has given me much food for thought.
abstract: Post-war reconstruction: replies to Prof Laski lr
